item.description:
@RealMarkDziak No, although it would be appropriate. She had arrived in the US a few weeks before, fresh out of Gymnasium on a fiancÃ©e visa. She went to work as crew at McD (until she could find a real job). Our first stop after the courthouse was to see her boss for free breakfast.

@RealMarkDziak Then (the romantics that we were) we took another city bus to the INS office in St. Paul to prove we have fulfilled the terms of her visa and apply for a green card. ğŸ˜ƒ
item.source:markdown:
@RealMarkDziak No, although it would be appropriate. She had arrived in the US a few weeks before, fresh out of Gymnasium on a fiancÃ©e visa. She went to work as crew at McD (until she could find a real job). Our first stop after the courthouse was to see her boss for free breakfast.
@RealMarkDziak Then (the romantics that we were) we took another city bus to the INS office in St. Paul to prove we have fulfilled the terms of her visa and apply for a green card. ğŸ˜ƒ

item.description: Thirty-nine years ago today, on the day after Labor Day, we took an MTC bus to downtown Minneapolis. We went to the Hennepin County Government Center and walked into the courtroom of Judge Susanne C. Sedgwick. When we came out we were married.
item.source:markdown: Thirty-nine years ago today, on the day after Labor Day, we took an MTC bus to downtown Minneapolis. We went to the Hennepin County Government Center and walked into the courtroom of Judge Susanne C. Sedgwick. When we came out we were married.

item.description: @c0urtneyH Our last station in the US was Arizona for 18 months and we loved the weather. I still vote there after 30 years away.
item.source:markdown: @c0urtneyH Our last station in the US was Arizona for 18 months and we loved the weather. I still vote there after 30 years away.

item.description:
@techman53 Thatâ€™s a lot of questions at one time! ğŸ˜€ I was motivated to not be dependent on my wife for German daily life. And without internet I had to inform myself and solve my problems in German. It took about 3 years to become truly competent in the language, though.

@techman53 I grew up in Minnesota and met my wife when she was an exchange student in high school. We married 3 years later and lived in the US 7 years before moving to Germany (for a career opportunity for her). I had visited Germany a few times so I knew what I was getting into.
item.source:markdown:
@techman53 Thatâ€™s a lot of questions at one time! ğŸ˜€ I was motivated to not be dependent on my wife for German daily life. And without internet I had to inform myself and solve my problems in German. It took about 3 years to become truly competent in the language, though.
@techman53 I grew up in Minnesota and met my wife when she was an exchange student in high school. We married 3 years later and lived in the US 7 years before moving to Germany (for a career opportunity for her). I had visited Germany a few times so I knew what I was getting into.
